item.description:
Limits of perception

Maarten Steenhagen is Lecturer in the Faculty of Philosophy at the University of Cambridge. He is a Bye-Fellow of Queens’ College and Director of Studies for Queens’ College and Selwyn College.

His research focuses on perception and the mind. In particular, he concentrates on the metaphysics of mind and on the role of perceptual media—such as sounds, images, and optical technology. His articles and papers cover the experience of sounds, images, and mirror perception, as well as evaluations of the different theories of perception.

In addition to his work on perception, Steenhagen is interested in the history of 20th century philosophy, in particular the controversies about philosophical method and the presuppositions and value of analysis in philosophy.

At Cambridge Steenhagen lectures on Philosophical Logic and Metaphysics. He supervises students for a broad range of topics, including Meaning, Personal Identity, Aesthetics, and Philosophy of Mind and Cognitive Science.
